comment: worst math teacher ever. math test have nothing to do with what you learned in class. everything she teaches in class is basic crap,but she expects you to solve questions that not even my math tutor can solve on the test.
She was average.  Made some mistakes and expects a lot from you.  She tells you whats on the test. Make sure u do the MATH XL homework.
she is awesome, just do the homework and u will be fine, it is all online anyway

I found Mrs. Wailes to be extremely rude. I attended every class, completed every homework assignment and still struggled. She seemed annoyed when students would ask questions. When you were taking tests, she would walk around and call out students mistakes making you feel stupid. I strongly recommend not taking ANY course from her EVER!

Mrs. Wailes is very sweet lady and is always willing to help, however, she can be a bit boring. The textbook isn't needed since it's on MathXL...If you end up with her be sure to ASK LOTS OF QUESTIONS!!!

She's very boring, but she does admit that she's only trying to teach us the required stuff, not for math majors. If you've taken precalc before then it'll be easy for you, but I suggest a more interactive and lively professor if you'll be learning it for the first time. The online homework explains how to work problems almost better than she does.
She's not the best not the worst. If you just need to take the class, take her. Make sure you speak up if you need help because she loves to help!

I didn't like this class at all. I always wanted to fall asleep in class because it was quite boring at times. She confuses the class and isn't very helpful. The hw is online so you really don't need a book. I wouldn't take her again if I could.

i did not enjoy this class one bit. if you have taken precal or higher you will get really frustrated watching her teach because she teaches things wrong and then goes back and fixes them after everyone is wayyy confused. it was the easy A i was hoping for, but it became really hard to not skip class/stay awake after the second week in the semester

Easy class, especially if you took Algebra II or some sort of precal class in high school. Moves really slow, so easy to understand regardless. Slow speed means boredom for those who already know. Homework online. Does not have a strict "late-to-class" policy. Tests easy.
if you took precalculus before, do not buy the textbook. you can make an A if you study and do your online homework.

She's not horrible, but she's not good either. Tests weren't too bad if you knew what you were doing, HW online so it was very easy. She can get confusing sometimes, but if you're good at math it shouldn't be a problem. I wouldn't reccommend her for those who don't understand math.

She should be retired.  She's not helpful, she makes a lot of simple errors that confuses the class (but if you have her now-use her mistakes to get out early. 3 strikes you get to leave), and she takes off points for the STUPIDEST things. i agree with whoever said get out now.
ughghghgh she annoyed me so much, she counts off for dumb stuff and doesn't know what she's talkin bout

If you're naturally good at math or have taken precal. before, you'll be totally bored in this class because she goes really slow. She is a little confusing & her test are a little hard - but aren't all precal. tests hard?

She is funny...but only because she is so confused. She is willing to help but she gets herself confused, which confuses the class even more. We had four tests, four quizzes, mymathlab homework, and a final. She reviews for each test but they are still somewhat hard. I would recommend her though.
she does get you confused sometimes but she still will explain anything u dont understand
She is an older woman, probably belongs more in High School than college. Has a few old person moments, but she teaches ok. Just do your online homework and this class is a breeze.

I hate her class. I take a book and read it. She over simplifies things and repeats herself so much that even having taken Precalculus before, she confused me. She just totally lost me. That and her voice grated on my last nerve. The only reason I am doing well in her class is because I came into it from another precal class.
She's cool cause she'll take the time to explain anything that you don't understand. The homework is online and the class is fairly easy.
She has a lot of years experience (40 years I think) and is very understanding. I can promise you she will hold up class for you to make sure you know the material.

very unclear in teaching methods, expectes you to know things already, i even asked for an example out of the book and she changed the question inbetween me asking and her writing by skipping a step no one in the class knew; get out if you can
